newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada board sets 1997 pipeline rate of return.
newsitem.headline: Canada board sets 1997 pipeline rate of return.

text.p: Canada's National Energy Board said on Friday that it set the rate of return on common equity for the country's major oil and natural gas pipelines at 10.67 percent.

The new rate for the so-called Group 1 pipelines is the second adjustment under the NEB's multi-pipeline cost of capital decision of April 1995. The 1995 rate of return was set at 12.25 percent and the 1996 rate was 11.25 percent.
The new rate covers the 1997 return on common equity.
Group 1 gas pipelines include Alberta Natural Gas Co Ltd, Foothills Pipe Lines Ltd, TransCanada PipeLines Ltd, Trans Quebec and Maritimes Inc and Westcoast Energy Inc.
Alberta Natural Gas is owned by TransCanada, Foothills is owned by Westcoast and NOVA Corp, and Trans Quebec is owned by TransCanada and Gaz Metropolitain and Co LP.
The only crude oil pipeline covered by the NEB decision is BC Gas Inc's Trans Mountain Pipe Line Co Ltd.
